channel.title: 1 error (tryed most possibilities)

item.title: 1 error (tryed most possibilities)
item.dc:creator: @akanaz akanaz
item.description:
@akanaz wrote:

Hey guys,

This is the contents of my chair.java:

import java.io.*; public class Chair { public double chairLegs() { return Math.random()*4; } public boolean chairIsBroken(double legs) { if (legs < 4) { return true; } else { return false; } } public String returnInstances() { return chairIsBroken(chairLegs()) ? "Broken." : "Not broken."; } public static void main (String[] args) { System.out.println(returnInstances()); } }

The errors are:

:: Preparing for compile... :: Auto-setting envriomental variables... :: :: Scanning for latest JDK version... :: :: Found JDK 1.6.0_05 :: Results: Chair.java:17: non-static method returnInstances() cannot be referenced from a s tatic context System.out.println(returnInstances()); ^ 1 error :: Done! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
